item.title: FindNUS :telescope:
item.description: Executive Summary: Awarded the highest level of achivement, given to the top 7% of teams (top 29 of 414 teams) for NUS School of Computing’s 2022 iteration of Orbital. FindNUS is a lost and found web app built during Summer 2022 Orbital. As the backend developer, I built a RESTful API backend using a microservices architecture. Apart from regular CRUD, we also used some NLP and fuzzy searching to help lost people find their lost stuff.

item.title: SnipNScan :camera:
item.description: Executive Summary: Using OpenCV and Tesseract, I built a QR code and text scanner because too much text in this world is embedded in images and are un-copypasteable. Think of images of code. ðŸ”¸ Project Blogpost ðŸ”¸ Project Link

item.title: Software Developer Intern
item.description: HackerTrail uses data-driven technology to evaluate and connect software professionals to employers. Developed on the “Employer Management Platform”, extending on existing features using Angular Developed new features and UI improvements on the “Candidate Platform” using React, driving a successful UX revamp Built an exploratory backend API using FastAPI to automate company messaging processes Tested with some frontend frameworks to test their SEO effectiveness for the companyâ€™s landing page Recommendation by my team lead on my SWE skills.

item.title: Software Engineer Intern
item.description: TOFFS provides Multi-CDN and cybersecurity solutions for Enterprise networking. Integrated an Anti-DDoS machine learning (ML) script into company networking infrastructure Processed large amounts of data (approx 2.5TB worth) with concurrent programming to train ML models Optimised model training, achieving up to 50% reduction in training time Testimonial on my work by Co-Founder Jason Kong.
